javadoc:
The RTTI2 data type represents an array of either pointers or displacements to the BaseClassDescriptors (RTTI 1s) for a class.

Fields for this RunTimeTypeInformation structure can be found on http://www.openrce.org

RTTI_Base_Class_Array is the label for the RTTI2 data structure. @deprecated Use of this dynamic data type class is no longer recommended. Instead an array of either pointers or displacements to BaseClassDescriptor structures can be obtained using the Rtti2Model.

methods.javadoc: Creates a dynamic Base Class Array data type.

methods.comment: Creates a dynamic Base Class Array data type.

Creates a dynamic Base Class Array data type.

params.comment: the number of rtti1 refs

Creates a dynamic Base Class Array data type.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Creates a dynamic Base Class Array data type.

params.name: rtti1Count
params.comment: the number of rtti1 refs

params.name: dtm
params.comment: the data type manager for this data type.

methods.name: getLength
methods.comment:
Gets the total length of the data created when this data type is placed at the indicated 
 address in memory.

params.name: memory
params.comment: the program memory for this data.

params.name: address
params.comment: the start address of the data.

params.name: bytes
params.comment: the bytes for this data.

return.comment:
the length of the data. zero is returned if valid data can't be created at the 
 indicated address using this data type.

methods.name: getRtti1Address
methods.comment:
Gets address referred to by the RTTI 1 pointer at the specified index in the RTTI2's 
 array that is at the rtti2Address.

params.name: memory
params.comment: the program memory containing the RTTI 2

params.name: rtti2Address
params.comment: the address of the RTTI 2

params.name: rtti1Index
params.comment: the index of RTTI 1 entry in the RTTI 2 array

return.comment: the address of the RTTI 1 referred to by the indexed array element.

methods.name: getRtti1Address
methods.comment:
Gets address referred to by the RTTI 1 pointer at the specified index in the RTTI2's 
 array that is at the rtti2Address.

params.name: program
params.comment: the program containing the RTTI 2

params.name: rtti2Address
params.comment: the address of the RTTI 2

params.name: rtti1Index
params.comment: the index of RTTI 1 entry in the RTTI 2 array

return.comment: the address of the RTTI 1 referred to by the indexed array element.

methods.name: isValidRtti1Pointer
methods.comment: Determines if the RTTI 1 pointer in the RTTI2 structure is valid.

params.name: program
params.comment: the program

params.name: startAddress
params.comment: the address of the RTTI 2 structure

params.name: pointerIndex
params.comment: index of the element in the array that makes up the RTTI 2.

params.name: overwriteInstructions
params.comment:
true indicates that existing instructions can be overwritten 
 by this data type.

params.name: overwriteDefinedData
params.comment:
true indicates that existing defined data can be overwritten 
 by this data type.

return.comment: true if the indicated RTTI1 pointer is valid.

methods.name: isValidRtti1Pointer
methods.comment: Determines if the RTTI 1 pointer in the RTTI2 structure is valid.

params.name: program
params.comment: the program

params.name: startAddress
params.comment: the address of the RTTI 2 structure

params.name: pointerIndex
params.comment: index of the element in the array that makes up the RTTI 2.

params.name: validationOptions
params.comment: options indicating how to perform the validation

return.comment: true if the indicated RTTI1 pointer is valid.

name: RTTI2DataType
comment:
The RTTI2 data type represents an array of either pointers or displacements to the 
 BaseClassDescriptors (RTTI 1s) for a class.
 
 Fields for this RunTimeTypeInformation structure can be found on http://www.openrce.org
 
 RTTI_Base_Class_Array is the label for the RTTI2 data structure.
